debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Let's talk about --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Let's get off the subject of China. Let's talk around sitting around the table. Come on, Joe, you can do better.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: We're going to talk about North Korea now. President Trump, you've met with North Korean leader, Kim Jong Un, three times. You've talked about your beautiful letters with him. You've touted the fact that there hasn't been a war or a long range missile test, and yet North Korea recently rolled out its biggest ever intercontinental ballistic missile and continues to develop its nuclear arsenal.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Do you see that as a betrayal of the relationship you forged? Just 30 seconds here because we need to get onto the next one.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: So, when I met with Barack Obama, we sat in the White House right at the beginning, had a great conversation. It was supposed to be 15 minutes and it was well over an hour. He said the biggest problem we have with North is North Korea. He indicated we will be in a war with North Korea. Guess what, it would be a nuclear war, and he does have plenty of nuclear capability.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: In the meantime, I have a very good relationship with him, different kind of a guy, but he probably thinks the same thing about me. We have a different kind of a relationship. We have a very good relationship and there's no war. And you know, about two months ago, he broke into a certain area. They said, there's going to be trouble.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: I said no, they're not because he's not going to do that. And I was right. Look, instead of being in a war where millions of people -- Seoul, you know, is 25 miles away, millions and millions -- 32 million people in Seoul, millions of people would be dead right now.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: President Trump, that's 30 seconds, thank you. Vice President Biden, to you, North Korea conducted four nuclear tests under the Obama administration. Why do you think you would be able to rein in this persistent threat?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Because I'd make it clear which we are making clear to China, they had to be part of the deal because here's the route, I made it clear and a -- as spokesperson of the administration when I went to China, that they said why are you moving your missile defense up so close? Why are you moving more forces here?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Why are you continue to do military maneuvers with South Korea? I said because North Korea is a problem and we're going to continue to do it so we can control them. We're going to make sure we can control them and make sure they cannot hurt us. And so if you want to do something about it, step up and help.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: If not, it's going to continue. What has he done? He's legitimized North Korea. He's talked about his good buddy who's a thug, a thug, and he talks about how we're better off and they are have much more capable missiles able to reach U.S. territory much more easily than ever did before.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Let me follow up with you, Vice President Biden. You've said you wouldn't meet with Kim Jong Un without preconditions. Are there any conditions under which you would meet with him?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: On the condition that he would agree that he would be drawing down his nuclear capacity to get the -- the Korean Peninsula should be nuclear free zone.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: All right, let's move on to American families. Very quickly, 10 seconds, President.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: They tried to meet with him, he wouldn't do it. He didn't like Obama. He didn't like him. He wouldn't do it.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: OK. I got to give him a chance to respond to that before we move on.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: You know what --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: And that's OK. You know what, North Korea, we're not in a war. We have a good relationship. You know, people don't understand. Having a good relationship with the leaders of other countries is a good thing.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: President Trump, we have to move on because we have a lot of country, we have of a lot of questions to get to. Your response.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: And we had a good relationship with Hitler before he, in fact, invaded Europe, the rest of Europe. Come on. Here's the reason he would not meet with President Obama is because President Obama said we're going to talk about denuclearization. We're not going to legitimize you. We're going to continue to put stronger and stronger sanctions on you.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: That's why he wouldn't meet with us.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: And it didn't happen, excuse me.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Let's move on and talk about American family. President Trump, OK, we do need to move on.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: They left me a mess. North Korea was a mess. And in fact, if you remember the first two or three months, there was a very dangerous period in my first three months before we sort of worked things out a little bit.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: OK.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: There was a very da -- they left us a mess and Obama would be, I think, the first to say, it was the single biggest problem he thought that our country.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: OK, let's move on to American families and the economy. One of the issues that's most important to them is health care as you both know. Today, there was a key vote on a new Supreme Court Justice Amy Coney Barrett and health care is at the center of her confirmation fight. Over 20 million Americans get their health insurance through the Affordable Care Act. It's headed to the Supreme Court and your administration, Mr. President, is advocating for the court to overturn it. If the Supreme Court does overturn that law, there's 20 million Americans could lose their health insurance almost overnight.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: So what would you do if those people have their health insurance taken away? You have two minutes uninterrupted.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: First of all, I've already done something that nobody thought was possible. Through the legislature, I terminated the individual mandate. That is the worst part of Obamacare as we call it. The individual mandate where you have to pay a fortune for the privilege of not having to pay for bad health insurance.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: I terminate it. It's gone. Now, it's in court because Obamacare is no good. But then I made a decision, run it as well as you can to my people, great people. Run it as well as you can. I could've gone the other route and made everybody very unhappy. They ran it. Premiums are down, everything's down. Here's the problem.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: No matter how well you run it, it's no good. What we'd like to do is terminate it. We have the individual mandate done. I don't know that it's going to work. If we don't win, we will have to run it and we'll have Obamacare. But it'll be better one. But it no longer is Obamacare because without the individual mandate, it's much different.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Pre-existing conditions will always stay. What I would like to do is a much better health care, much better, will always protect people with pre-existing. So I'd like to terminate Obamacare, come up with a brand new beautiful health care. The Democrats will do it because there'll be tremendous pressure on them.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: And we might even have the house by that time. And I think we're going to win the House, OK. You'll see, but I think we're going to win the House. But come up with a better health care, always protecting people with pre-existing conditions. And one thing very important, we have 180 million people out there that have great private health care, far more than we're talking about with Obamacare.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Joe Biden is going to terminate all of those policies. These are people that love their health care. People that have been successful. Middle income people, been successful. They have a 180 million plans, 180 million people, families. Under what he wants to do, which will basically be socialized medicine.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: He won't even have a choice. They want to terminate 180 million plans. We have done an incredible job on health care and we're going to do even better.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: OK. Vice President Biden, yes, this is for you. Your health care plan calls for building on Obamacare. So my question is, what is your plan if the law is ruled unconstitutional by the Supreme Court? You have two minutes uninterrupted.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: What I'm going to do is pass Obamacare with a public option, become Bidencare. The public option is an option that says that if you, in fact, do not have the wherewithal to be -- if you qualify for Medicaid and you do not have the wherewithal, then your state to get Medicaid, you're automatically enrolled, providing competition for insurance companies.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: That's what's going to happen. Secondly, we're going to make sure we reduce the premiums and reduce drug prices by making sure that there's competition that doesn't exist now by allowing the Medicare to negotiate drug prices with the insurance companies. Thirdly, the idea that I want to eliminate private insurance.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: The reason why I had such a fight for it with 20 candidates for their nomination was I support private insurance. That's why I didn't -- not one single person of private insurers would lose their insurance under my plan, nor did they under Obamacare. They did not lose their insurance unless they chose they wanted to go to something else.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Lastly, we're going to make sure we're in a situation that we actually protect pre-existing. There's no way he can protect preexisting conditions, none, zero. You can't do it in the ether. He's been talking about this for a long time. There is no -- he's never come up with a plan. I guess we're gonna get the pre-existing condition plan the same time we get the infrastructure plan that we've been waiting since 17, 18, 19 and 20. The fact -- I still go for a few more minutes, I know you're getting anxious.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: The fact is that there -- he's already cost the American people because of his terrible handling of the COVID virus and the economic spillover. 10 million people have lost their private insurance and he wants to take away 22 million more people who have it under Obamacare and over 110 million people with pre-existing conditions and all the people from COVID are going to have pre-existing conditions.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: What are they going to do?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: I have a follow up for you, Vice President Biden, it relates to something that President Trump said he's accusing you of wanting socialized medicine. What do you say to people who have concerns that your health care plan, which includes a government insurance option, takes the country one step closer to a health care system run entirely by the government?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: I'd say it's ridiculous. It's like saying that, you know, we're -- the idea that -- the fact that there's a public option that people can choose that makes it a socialist plan? Look, the difference between the President -- and I think healthcare is not a privilege, it's a right. Everyone should have the right to have affordable health care.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: And I am very proud of my plan. It's gotten endorsed by all the major labor unions, as well as -- as well as a whole range of other people who, in fact, are concerned in the medical field. This is something that's going to save people's lives and this is going to give some people an opportunity, an opportunity to have health care for their children.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: How many of you home are worried and rolling around in bed tonight wondering what in God's name you're going to do if you get sick because you've lost your home insurance, your -- your health insurance your company is gone under? We have to provide health insurance for people and at an affordable rate, and that's what I do.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: President Trump --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Excuse me, he was there for 47 years. He didn't do it. He was now there as Vice President for eight years and it's not like it was 25 years ago, it was three and three quarters. It was just a little while ago, right, less than four years ago. He didn't do anything. He didn't do it. He wants socialized medicine and it's not that he wants it, his Vice President I mean.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: She is - is more liberal than Bernie Sanders and wants it even more. Bernie Sanders wants it. The Democrats want it. You're going to have socialized medicine, just like you want with fracking. We're not going to have fracking. We're going to stop fracking. We're going to stop fracking. Then he goes to Pennsylvania after he gets a nomination where he got very lucky to get it and he goes to Pennsylvania and he says, we're going to have fracking, and you never asked that question.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: And by the way, so far, I respect very much the way you're handling this, I have to say. But somebody should ask the question, he goes for a year, there will no fracking --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: We have a -- we have a -- we do have a number of -- we're going to -- we're going to get to --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: The same thing with socialized medicine.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: I have to respond.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Vice President, your response, please.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: My response is people deserve to have affordable health care period, period, period, period, and the Bidencare proposal will, in fact, provide for that affordable health care, lower premiums. What we're going to do is going to cost some money. It's going to cost over $750 billion over 10 years to do it and they're going to be able to lower premiums.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: You can buy into the better plans, the cheaper plans, lower your premiums, deal with un -- un -- unexpected billing and have your drug prices drop significantly. He keeps talking about it. He hasn't done a thing for anybody on health care, not a thing.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Very quick, then I want to talk about

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: When he says public option, he's talking about socialized medicine and when he -- and -- and health care. When he talks about a public option, he's talking about destroying your Medicare, totally destroyed, and destroying your Social Security. And this whole country will come down. You know, Bernie Sanders tried it in his state.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: He tried it in his state. His governor was a very liberal governor. They want to make it work.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: OK. Let's hear -- let's Vice President Biden's response. Vice President Biden, your response.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: He's a very confused guy. He thinks he's running against somebody else. He's running against Joe Biden. I beat all those other people because I disagreed with them. Joe Biden, he's running against. And the idea that we're in a situation that are going to destroy Medicare. This is the guy that the actuary Medicare said if in fact at -- at Social Security, if in fact he continues to withhold his plan to withhold the tax on Social Security, Social Security will be bankrupt in by 2023, with no way to make up for it. This is the guy who's tried to cut Medicare.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: So though -- I don't -- I mean the idea that Donald Trump is lecturing me on Social Security and Medicare, come on.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: He tried to get rid of -- he tried to hurt Social Security years ago, years ago. Go back and look at the records. He tried to hurt Social Security years ago.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: All right. Let's move on. I'm going to move on to the next question or else we're not going to have time to it.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: The stock market will boom if I'm elected. If he's elected, the stock market will crash.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: OK. Let's move on to the next question. Very quickly.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Look, the idea that the stock market is booming is his only measure of what's happening. Where I come from is Scranton and Claymont, that people don't live off of the stock market. Just in the -- just in the last three -- three years during this crisis, s -- said the -- the billionaires in this country made according to The Wa -- Wall Street, $700 billion more , $700 billion more dollars because that's his only measure.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: What happens to the ordinary people out there? What happens to them?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Let's talk about what's happening on Capitol Hill. We're -- we're going to move on.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: 401 case are through the roof.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: We're going to move on.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: People's stock are through the roof and he doesn't come from Scranton. That's like one of the -- he lived there for a short period of time before he even knew and he left. And the people of Pennsylvania will show you that.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Let me move on to my next question, gentlemen. As, of tonight more than 12 million people are out of work and as of tonight, 8 million more Americans have fallen into poverty and more families are going hungry every day. Those hit hardest are women and people of color. They see Washington fighting over a relief bill.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Mr. President, why haven't you been able to get them the help they need? 30 seconds here.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Because Nancy Pelosi doesn't want to approve it. I do.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: But you're the President.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: I do, but I still have to get, unfortunate. That's one of the reasons I think we're going to take over the house because of her. Nancy Pelosi doesn't want to approve anything because she'd love to have some victories on a date called November 3rd. Nancy Pelosi does not want to approve it. We are ready, willing and able to do something.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Don't forget, we've already approved three plans and it's gone through including the Democrats, in all fairness. This one, she doesn't want us near the election because she thinks it helps her politically. I think it hurts her politically.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: All right, Mr. Vice President, let --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: how the Republican leader in the -- in -- in the United States Senate said he can't pass it. He will not be able to pass it. He does not have Republican votes. Why isn't he talking to his Republican friends?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Let me follow up with you, Vice President Biden.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: If we made a deal, the Republican --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Let me -- let me ask Vice President Biden a question. You are the leader of the Democratic Party. Why have you not pushed the Democrats to get a deal for the American people?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Well, I have, and they have pushed you it. Look, they passed this act all the way back in the beginning of the summer. This is like -- it's not new, it's been out there. This Heroes Act have been sitting there, and look at what's happening. When I was in charge of the Recovery Act with $800 billion, I was able to get $145 billion to local communities that have to balance their budgets, the states have to balance their budgets, so then have to fire -- fire -- they have to fire firefighters, teachers, first responders, law enforcement officers, so they can keep their cities and counties running.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: He will not support that. They have not done a thing for them. And Mitch McConnell said, let them go bankrupt, let them go bankrupt. Come on, what's the matter these guys?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: The bill that was passed in the house was a bailout of badly run high crime Democrat, were all run by Democrats, cities and states. It was a way of getting a lot of money, billions and billions of dollars to this state. It was also a way of getting a lot of money from our people's pockets to people that come into our country illegally.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: We were going to take care of everything for them and what that does and I'd love to do that. I'd love to help them. But what that does, everybody all over the world will start pouring into our country. We can't do it. This was a way of taking care of them. This was a way of spending on things that had nothing to do with COVID as for your question.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: But it was really a big bailout for badly run Democrat cities and states.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: All right, I want to --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: If get elected, I'm not going to -- I'm running as a proud Democrat, But I'm going to be an American President. I don't see red states and blue states. What I see is American, United States. And folks, every single state out there finds themselves in trouble. They're going to start laying off whether they're red or blue, cops, firefighters, first responders, because -- teachers because they have to balance their budget, and the founders were smart.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: They allowed the federal government to deficit spend to compensate for the United States of America.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: I want to talk about the minimum wage, gentlemen. Mr. Vice President, we are talking a lot about struggling small businesses and business owners these days. Do you think this is the right time to ask them to raise the minimum wage support a $15 federal minimum?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: I do, because I think one of the things we're going to have to do is we're going to have to bail them out too. We should be bailing them out now, those small businesses. You got one in six of them going under. They're not going to be able to make it back. They passed the pre -- a package that allows us to be able to called PPP. Money is supposed to go to help them do everything from organize, how they can deal with their businesses being open safely.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Schools, how they can make classrooms smaller, how they can hire more teachers, how they can put ventilation systems in. They need the help, the businesses, as well as the schools need the help. But this -- because these guys will not help them. He's not giving them any of the money.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: We are going to move on to immigration but I want to get your reaction --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: He said we have to help our small businesses by raising the minimum wage? That's not helping. I think it should be a state option. Alabama is different than New York. New York is different from Vermont. Every state is different. It should be a state option.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: You said very recently --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: We have to help -- it's very important. We have to help our small business. How are you helping your small businesses when you're forcing wages, what's going to happen and what's been proven to happen is when you do that, these small businesses fire many of their employees.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: You said very recently you will consider raising the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour. You said recently you would consider raising the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour. Is that still the case?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: And I would consider it and to an extent. But what I really like --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: In a second administration?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: What I really -- in a second administration. But not to a level that's going to put all these businesses out of business. It should be a state option. Look, in different places I know different places, they're all different. In some places, $15 is not so bad. In other places, other states, $15 is a

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: OK, President Trump. Thank you. Quick response, Vice President Biden.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Two jobs, one job below poverty. People are making six, seven, eight bucks an hour. These first responders, we all clap for as they come down the street because they've allowed us to make it. What's happening? They deserve a minimum wage of $15 dollars, anything below that puts you below the poverty level and there is no evidence that when you raise the minimum wage, businesses go out of business.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: That is simply not true.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: We're going to talk about immigration. We're going to talk about immigration now, gentlemen, and we're going to talk about families within this context. Mr. President, your administration separated children from their parents at the border, at least 4,000 kids. You've since reversed your zero tolerance policy, but the United States can't locate the parents of more than 500 children.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: So how will these families ever be reunited?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Children are brought here by coyotes and lots of bad people, cartels, and they're brought here and they used to use them to get into our country. We now have as strong a border as we've ever had. We're over 400 miles of brand new wall. You see the numbers and we let people in, but they have to come in legally and they come in through

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: But are you reuniting kids with their family, Mr. President?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Let me just tell you. They built cages. You know, they used to say I built the cages and then they had a picture in a certain newspaper and it was a picture of these horrible cages and they said look at these cages, President Trump built them. And then it was determined they were built in 2014. That was him.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Do you have a plan to reunite the kids with their parents?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Yes, we're working on it very -- we're -- we're trying very hard. But a lot of these kids come out without the parents. They come over through cartels and through coyotes and through gangs.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Vice President Biden, let me bring you into this conversation. Quick response and then another question to you.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: These 500 plus kids came with parents. They separated them at the border to make it a disincentive to come to begin with. They grill tough. We're really strong. And guess what, they cannot -- it's not coyotes didn't bring them over. Their parents were with them. They got separated from their parents and it makes us a laughingstock and violates every notion of who we are as a nation.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Let me ask you a follow up.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Kirsten, they did it. We changed the policy.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Your response to that.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: We did not separated --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Who built the cages? Who built the cages?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Let's talk about what we're talking about. What happened? Parents were ripped, their kids were ripped from their arms and separated, and now they cannot find over 500 of sets of those parents and those kids are alone, nowhere to go. Nowhere to go. It's criminal, it's criminal.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Let me ask you about --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Kirsten, I will say this. They went down. We brought reporters, everything. They are so well taken care of. They're in facilities that was so clean.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: But some of them haven't been reunited with their family.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: But just ask one question, who built the cages? I'd love you to ask of that. Who built the cages?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Let me ask about your immigration policy, Mr. Vice President. The Obama administration did fail to deliver immigration reform, which had been a key promise during the administration, and also presided over record deportations as well as family detentions at the border before changing course. So why should voters trust you with an immigration overhaul now?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Because we made a mistake, it made too -- it took too long to get it right, took too long to get it right. I'll be President of United States, not Vice President of United States. And the fact is, I've made it very clear, within 100 days, I'm going to send the United States Congress a pathway to citizenship for over 11 million undocumented people.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: And all those so-called Dreamers, those DACA kids, they're going to be immediately certified again to be able to stay in this country and put on a path to citizenship. The idea that they are being sent home by this guy and they want to do that is they're going to a country they've never seen before. I can imagine, you're five years old, your parents are taking across the r -- r -- the Rio Grande r -- r -- River and it's -- and it's -- and it's illegal.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: And you say, no, mom, leave me here. I'm not going to go with you. They bet here. Many of them are model citizen. Over 20,000 of them are first responders, out there taking care of people during this crisis. We owe them. We owe them.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: President Trump.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Kirsten, he had eight years to do what he said he was going to do. And I've changed without having a specific, we got rid of catch and release, we got rid of a lot of horrible things that they put in and that they lived with. But he had eight years, he was Vice President. He did nothing except build cages to keep children in.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Vice President Biden, your response.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: The catch and release, you know what's he's talking about there? If, in fact, you had a family came across and they were arrested. They, in fact, were given a date to show up for their hearing. They were released. And guess what? They showed up for a hearing. This is the first President in history of United States of America, does anybody seeking asylum has to do it in another country.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: That's never happened before in America. That's never happened before in America. You come to the United States and you make your case that I seek asylum based on the following -- on the following premise, why I deserve it under American law. They're sitting in squalor on the other side of the river.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: President Trump, your response, 30 seconds and then we move on.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: It just shows that he has no understanding of immigration or the laws. Catch and release is a disaster. A murderer would come in, a rapist would come in, a very bad person would come in, we would take their name. We have to release them into our country and then you say they come back. Less than 1% of the people come back.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: We have to send ICE out and border patrol out to find them. We would say come back in two years, three years. We're going to give you a court case. You did Perry Mason. We're going to give you a court case. When you say they come back, they don't come back, Joe. They never come back. Only the really -- I hate to say this, but those with the lowest IQ, they might come back.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: OK, President, let's give Vice President Biden a chance to respond and then we're going to move on to the next section.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: You don't know the law, Joe.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Vice President Biden, your response.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Know the law, what he's telling you is simply not true.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Well, check it out, they don't come back.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Check it out.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: All right, let's move on to the next section.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: But we don't have to worry about it because I terminated it. So we don't have to worry it.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Let's move on about that right on to the next section.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: And you have 525 kids not knowing where in God's name they're going to be and lost their parents.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Go ahead.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: All right. Let's talk about our next section, which is race in America. And I want to talk about the way black and brown Americans experience race in this country. Part of that experience is something called the talk. It happens regardless of class and income. Parents who feel they have no choice but to prepare their children for the chance that they could be targeted, including by the police for no reason other than the color of their skin.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Mr. Vice President, in the next two minutes, I want you to speak directly to these families. Do you understand why these parents fear for their children?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: I do -- I do. You know, my daughter is a social worker and she's all -- she's written a lot about this. She's a -- has her graduate degree from the University of Pennsylvania in social work. And you know, one of the reasons why I ended up working on the east side of Wilmington, Delaware, which is 90% African-American was to learn more about what was going on. What I didn't -- I never had to tell my daughter if she's pulled over, make sure she puts for traffic stop, put both hands on top of the wheel and don't reach for the glove box because someone may shoot you.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: But a black parent no matter how wealthy or how poor they are has to teach their child when you're walking down the street don't have a hoodie on when you go across the street. Making sure that you, in fact, if you get pulled over, just yes sir, no sir, hands on top of the wheel because you are, in fact, the victim whether you're a person making 300,000 $300,000 a year person or someone who is on -- on -- on food stamps.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: The fact of the matter is there is institutional racism in America and we have always said we've never lived up to it. We hold these truths to be self-evident. All men and women are created equal. And guess what, we have never ever lived up to, but we've all constantly been moving the needle further and further to inclusion, not exclusion.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: This is the first President to come along and says that's the end of that. We're not going to do that anymore. We have to provide for economic opportunity, better education, better health care, better access to schooling, better access to opportunity to borrow money to start businesses. All the things we can do, and I've laid out a clear plan as to how to do those things just to give people a shot.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: It's about accumulating the ability to have wealth as well as it is to be free from violence.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: President Trump, same question to you and let me remind you of the question. I would like you to speak directly to these families. Do you understand why these parents fear for their children?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Yes, I do. And again, he's been in government 47 years. He never did a thing except in 1994 when he did such harm to the black community and they were called and he called them super predators. And he said that, he said it, super predators, and they could never live that down. 1994, your crime bill, the super predators.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Nobody has done more for the black community than Donald Trump. And if you look, with the exception of Abraham Lincoln, possible exception. But the exception of Abraham Lincoln, nobody has done what I've done. Criminal justice reform, Obama and Joe didn't do it. I don't even think they tried because they had no chance at doing it. They might have wanted to do it. But if you had to see the arms I had a twist to get that done.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: It was not a pretty picture and everybody knows it, including some very liberal people that cried in my office. They cried in the Oval Office. Two weeks later, they're out saying, gee, we have to defeat him. Criminal justice reform, prison reform, opportunity zones with Tim Scott, a great Senator from South Carolina.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: He came in with this incredible idea for opportunity zones. It's one of the most successful programs. People don't talk about it. Tremendous investment is being made. Biggest beneficiary, the black and Hispanic communities, and then historically black colleges and universities after three years of coming to the office.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: I love some of those guys, they were great. They came into the office and they said, I said, what are you doing? After three years, I said, why do you keep coming back? Because we have no funding. I said you don't have to come back every year. We have to come back because President Obama would never give them long term funding and I did 10 year long term funding and I gave them more money than they asked for because they said I think you need more.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: And I said the only bad part about this is I may never see you again because I got very friendly with them and they like me and I like them, but I saved colleges and universities.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: OK. And we're going to talk about both of your record. But your response to that Vice President.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: My response to that is I never ever said what he accused me of saying. The fact of the matter is in 2000 though after the crime bill had been in -- in -- in the law for a while, this is guy who said the problem with the crime bill, there's not enough people in jail. There's not enough people in jail. And go on my website, get the quote, the date when he said it, not enough people.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: He talked about marauding gangs, young gangs and the people who were going to maraud our cities. This is a guy who in the Central Park, five -- five innocent black kids, he continued to push for making sure that they got the death penalty. None of them were -- none of them were guilty of what the crime -- of the crimes they were suggested.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Look, and talk about he granted, he did, in fact, that 20 people he commuted 20 people sentences. We commuted over a 1,000 people sentences, over 1,000. The very law he's talking about is the law that, in fact, initiated by Barack Obama. And secondly, we're in a situation here where we -- the federal prison system was reduced by 38,000 people under our administration and one of those things we should be doing, there should be no, no minimum ma -- mandatories in the law.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: That's why I'm offering $20 billion to states to change their state laws to eliminate minimum mandatories and set up drug courts. No one should be going to jail because they have a drug problem. They should be going to rehabilitation, not to jail. We should fundamentally change the system and that's what I'm going to do.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: But why didn't he do it four years ago? Why didn't you do that? Four years ago, even less than that, why didn't you do it?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: I am not --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: You're Vice President. You keep talking about all these things you're going to do and you're going to do this. But you were there just a short time ago and you guys did nothing.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: We did --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Joe, I -- I ran because of you, I ran because of Barack Obama because you did a poor job. If I thought you did a good job, I would have never run. I would have never run. I ran because of you. I'm looking at you now, you're a politician. I ran because of you.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: All right, Vice President Biden, your response to that. And then I do have some questions for both of you.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Well, I tell you what, I -- I hope he does look at me because what's happening here is you know who I am, you know who he is, you know his character, you know my character, you know our reputations for honor and telling the truth. I am anxious to have this race. I'm anxious to see this take place. I am the character of the country is on the ballot.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Our characters on the ballot. Look at us closely.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Let me ask them, follow up, please respond and then we're going to have follow up.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: If this is true about Russia, Ukraine, China, other countries, Iraq. If this is true, then he's a corrupt politician. So don't give me the stuff about how you're this innocent baby. Joe, they're calling you a corrupt politician.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: President Trump, I want to stay on the issue of race. We're talking about the issue.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Laptop from hell.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: President Trump, we're talking about race right now and I do want to stay on the issue of race. President Trump, you've --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: I have to respond to that.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Please, very quickly.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Look, there are 50 former national intelligence folks who said that what this he's accusing me of is a Russian plan. They have said that this is -- has all the care -- four, five former heads of the CIA, both parties, say what he's saying is a bunch of garbage. Nobody believes it except them, his and his good friend, Rudy Giuliani.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: You mean the laptop is now another Russia, Russia, Russia --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: That's exactly what -- that's exactly what it's all.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: This is where he's going. The laptop is Russia.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Gentlemen, I want to stay on the issue of race.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: You have to be kidding here. We go again with Russia.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: We're going to continue on the issue of race. Mr. President, you've described the Black Lives Matter movement as a symbol of hate. You've shared a video of a man chanting white power to millions of your supporters. You've said that black professional athletes exercising their First Amendment rights should be fired.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: What do you say to Americans who say that kind of language from a President is contributing to a climate of hate and racial strife?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Well, you have to understand, the first time I ever heard of Black Lives Matter, they were chanting pigs in a blanket, talking about police, pigs, pigs, talking about our police. Pigs in a blanket, fry em like bacon. I said that's a horrible thing and they were marching down the street, and that was my first glimpse of Black Lives Matter.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: I thought it was a terrible thing. As far as my relationships with all people, I think I have great relationships with all people. I am the least racist person in this room.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: But what do you say to Americans who are concerned by that rhetoric?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: I don't -- I -- I mean I don't know what to say. I got criminal justice reform done in prison reform and opportunity zones. I took care of black colleges and universities. I don't know what to say. They can say anything. I mean, they can say anything. It's a very -- it's makes me sad because I am -- I am the least racist person.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: I can't even see the audience because it's so dark. But I don't care who's in the audience. I'm the least racist person in this room.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: OK. Vice President, Biden. Let me ask you very quickly and then I have a follow up question for you.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Abraham Lincoln here is one of the most racist Presidents we've had in modern history. He pours fuel on every single racist fire. Every single. one started off his campaign coming down the escalator saying is getting rid of those Mexican rapists. He's banned Muslims because they're Muslims. He has moved around and made everything worse across the board.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: He says to them about the poor boys, last time we were on stage here, you said I told you to stand down and stand ready. Come on this guy is a dog whistle about as big as a foghorn.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: President Trump, I'm going to give you 10 seconds to respond and then I have follow up.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: You made a reference to Abraham Lincoln, where did that come in?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: You said Abrahal Lincoln.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Where did it -- No, no, you see -- I said not since Abraham Lincoln has anybody done what I've done for the black community.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: And I'm saying --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: I didn't say I'm Abraham Lincoln. I said, not since Abraham Lincoln has anybody done what I've done for the black community. Now, you have done nothing, other than the crime bill which put --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Oh, god.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: -- tens of thousands of black men mostly in jail.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: All right. Let me,

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: You know what, they remembered because if you look at what's happening with the voting right now. They remembered that you treated them very, very badly. Just take a look at what's happening out there.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Vice President Biden, let me give you a chance to respond within this context. Crime bills that you supported in the 80s and 90s contributed to the incarceration of tens of thousands of young black men who had small amounts of drugs in their possession. They are sons, they are brothers, their fathers, their uncles, whose families are still to this day, some of them suffering the consequences.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: So speak to those families, why should they vote for you?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: One of the things is that in the 80s, we passed 100%, all 100 Senators voted for it, a bill on drugs and how to deal with drugs. It was a mistake, I've been trying to change this since and particularly the portion on cocaine. That's why I've been arguing that in fact, we should not send anyone to jail for a pure drug offense.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: They should be going into treatment across the board. That's what we should be spending money. That's why set up drug courts which never funded by our Republican friends. They should not be going to jail for a drug or an alcohol problem. They should be going into treatment, treatment. That's what we've been trying to do. That's what I'm going to get done because I think maybe the American people have now seen that in fact, it was a mistake to pass those laws relating to the drug.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: But they were not in the crime bill.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: But why didn't he get it done? See it's all talk, no action with these politicians. Why didn't he get it done?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: That's what I'm going to do when I become President.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: You were Vice President along with Obama as your President, you're a leader for eight years. Why didn't you get it done yet? You have eight years to get it done? Now you're saying you're going to get it done because you're all talk and no action, Joe.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: We got a lot of it done. We released 38 we got 38,000 prisoners left from --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: You got nothing done.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: 38,000 prisoners were released from federal prison. We have -- there were over a 1,000 people who were given clemency. We make -- in fact we're the ones that put in the legislation saying we could look at pattern and practice of police departments and what they were doing, how they're conducting themselves.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: I could go on, but we began the process, we began the process, we lost an election. That's why I'm running to win back that election and change is terrible policy.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: I just asked one question. Why didn't you do it in the eight years? A short time ago. Why didn't you do it? You just said I'm going to do that. I'm going to do this. You put tens of thousands of mostly black young men in prison. Now you're saying you're going to get -- you're going to undo that. Why didn't you get it done?

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: You had eight years with Obama? You know why, Joe? Because you're all talk and no action.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: All right, Vice President Biden, then we're going to move on to the next section.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: And a Republican Congress.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: You've got to talk him into it. You've got to talk him into it.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: We're going to move on to our next session

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Like what I did with criminal justice reform. I have talked Democrats into it.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Gentlemen, we're running out of time, so we've got to get on to climate change please. You both have very different visions on climate change. President Trump, you say that environmental regulations have hurt jobs in the energy sector. Vice President Biden, you have said you see addressing climate change as an opportunity to create new jobs for each of you.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: How would you both combat climate change and support job growth? At the same time starting with you President Trump, you have two minutes uninterrupted.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: So we have the trillion trees program. We have so many different programs. I do love the environment, but what I want is that cleanest, crystal clear water, the cleanest air, we have the best lowest number in carbon emissions, which is a big standard that I notice Obama goes with all the time. Not Joe, I haven't heard Joe use the term because I'm not sure he knows what it represents or means, but I have heard Obama use it and we have the best carbon emission numbers that we've had in 35 years under this administration.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: We are working so well with industry. But here's what we can't do. Look at China, how filthy it is, look at Russia, look at India. It's filthy, the air is filthy, the Paris accord. I took us out because we were going to have to spend trillions of dollars and we were treated very unfairly when they put us in there.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: They did us a great disservice. They were going to take away our businesses. I will not sacrifice tens of millions of jobs, thousands and thousands of companies because of the Paris accord. It was so unfair. China doesn't kick in until 2030. Russia goes back to a low standard and we kicked in right away.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: It would have been -- it would have been -- it would have destroyed our business. So, you ready? We have done an incredible job environmentally. We have the cleanest air, the cleanest water, and the best carbon emission standards that we've seen in many, many years.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Vice President Biden --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: We haven't destroyed our industries.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: Vice President, Biden, two minutes to you, uninterrupted.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Climate change, climate warming, global warming is an existential threat to humanity. We have a moral obligation to do with it and we're told by all the leading scientists in the world, we don't have much time. We're going to past the point of no return with the next 8 to 10 years. Four more years of this man, eliminating all the regulations that were put in by us to clean up the climate, to clean up to limit the -- limit of emissions will put us in a position where we're going to be in real trouble.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Here's where we have a great opportunity. I was able to get both all the environmental organizations as well as labor, people worried about jobs to support my climate plan because what it does, it will create millions of new good paying jobs. We're going to invest in, for example, 500,000 -- 50,000, 50000 charging stations on our highways so that we can own the electric car market in the future.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: In the meantime, China is doing that. We're gonna be in a position where we're going to see to it that we're going to take 4 million existing billion buildings, and 2 million existing homes and retrofit them so they don't leak as much energy, saving hundreds of millions of barrels of oil in the process and creating significant number of jobs.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: And by the way, the whole idea of what this is all going to do, it's going to create millions of jobs and it's going to clean the environment, our health and our jobs are at stake. That's what's happening. And what right now, by the way, Wall Street firms indicated that my plan, my -- my plan will, in fact, create 18. 6 million jobs, 7 million more than his.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: This is from Wall Street. And I'll create $1 trillion more in economic growth than his proposal does. Not on climate, just on the economy.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: President Trump.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Came out and said very strongly $6,500 will be taken away from families under his plan. That his plan is an economic disaster. If you look at what he wants to do, you know the -- if you look at his --

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: Nothing to do with climate.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: You know developed it? AOC plus 3. They know nothing about the climate. I mean she's got a good line of stuff, but she knows nothing about the climate and they're all hopping through hoops for AOC plus three. Look. A real plan cost $100 trillion. If we had the best year in the history of our country for 100 years, we would not even come close to a number like that.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: When he says buildings, they want to take buildings down because they want to make bigger windows into smaller windows. As far as they're concerned, if you had no window, it would be a lovely thing. This is the craziest plan that anybody has ever seen and this wasn't done by smart people. This wasn't done by anybody.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Frankly, I don't even know how it can be good politically. They want to spend $100 trillion. That's their real number. He's trying to say it's six. It was $100 trillion. They want to knock down buildings and build new buildings with little tiny small windows. I mean and many other things and many other things.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: OK. Let me have the Vice President and we're running out of time and we have a lot more questions to get to. So let's hear from the Vice President. I have a number more questions.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: I don't know where he comes from, where he comes up with these numbers. $100 trillion. Give me a break. This plan was -- this plan to endorse every major, every major environmental group and every labor group. Labor. Because they know the future lies. The future lies in us being able to breathe and they know their good jobs and getting us there.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: And by the way, the fastest growing industry in America are -- Is -- is -- is the electric the -- excuse me, solar energy and wind, he thinks wind causes cancer. Windmills. It's the fastest growing jobs and they pay good prevailing wages 45, 50 bucks an hour, we can grow and we can be cleaner if we go the route I'm proposing.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Donald Trump
text: Excuse me.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Kristen Welker
text: President, please respond and I have to follow.

debate_name: 2020 NBC News Presidential Debate at Belmont University in Nashville, Tennessee
speaker: Joe Biden
text: We have energy independence for the first time. We don't need all of these countries that we had to fight war over because we needed their energy. We are energy independent. I know more about wind than you do. It's extremely expensive, kills all the birds. It's very intermittent. It's got a lot of problems and they happen to make the windmills in both Germany and China and the fumes coming up. If you're a believer in carbon emission, the fumes coming up to make make these massive windmills is more than anything that we're talking about with natural gas which is very clean.
